summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, Silas, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians, which is in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We always give thanks to God for all of you as we make mention of you in our prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we constantly remember before God our Father your work produced by faith, your labor produced by love, and your patient endurance produced by hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear brothers, loved by God, we know that God has chosen you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because our gospel did not come to you with mere words, but with power, with the Holy Spirit, and with deep conviction. You yourselves know very well what kind of people we proved to be for your sake, while we were with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also became imitators of us and of the Lord, when you welcomed the word during a time of great affliction with the joy from the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you became a model for all the believers in Macedonia and Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the word of the Lord has resounded from you not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith in God has become known. As a result, we do not need to say anything,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they themselves inform us about what kind of reception we received from you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also report how you patiently wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, the one who is going to rescue us from the coming wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, brothers, you yourselves know that our visit to you was not a waste of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though we had suffered previously and were treated shamefully in Philippi (as you know), we were bold in our God to speak the gospel of God to you in the face of great opposition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our appeal does not come from error or impure motives, or by way of deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, so we speak, not to please people but God, who examines our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, as you know, we never at any time used flattering speech, nor did we act with greed as a motive. God is our witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, we did not seek the praise of people (neither yours nor anyone else’s),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even though we could have been a burden as Christ’s apostles. On the contrary, we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother taking care of her own children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We yearned for you so much that we were delighted to share with you not only the gospel of God, but also our own lives, because you had become dear to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely, brothers, you remember our labor and hardship! We worked night and day so that we would not be a burden to any of you, while we preached the gospel of God to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses, and so is God, of how devout, righteous, and blameless we were toward you who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, you know that we treated each of you as a father deals with his own children:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: encouraging, comforting, and urging you to live lives worthy of God, who is calling you into his kingdom and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is also another reason we give thanks to God unceasingly, namely, when you received God’s word, which you heard from us, you did not receive it as the word of men but as the word of God (as it really is), which is now at work in you who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, brothers, you became imitators of God’s churches in Judea, which are in Christ Jesus, because you suffered the same things from your own countrymen as they did from the Jews
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and who severely persecuted us. They are not pleasing to God and are hostile to all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By hindering us from speaking to the Gentiles so that they may be saved, they are always filling up the full measure of their sins. And the wrath has come upon them completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for us, brothers, after we were separated from you like orphans for just a short time (in person, not in our heart), it was with great desire that we made every effort to see you again in person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we wanted to come to you (I, Paul, wanted this, not just once, but twice), but Satan hindered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, who is our hope or joy or crown about which we boast before our Lord Jesus when he returns? Is it not you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, you are our glory and our joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, when we could not stand it any longer, we thought it best to remain behind in Athens alone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we sent Timothy, our brother and coworker for God in the gospel of Christ. We sent him to strengthen and encourage you in your faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one will be shaken by these trials, for you know well that we are destined for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, even when we were with you, we told you ahead of time that we were going to suffer, and it happened just that way, as you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why, when I could not stand it any longer, I sent to find out about your faith, because I was afraid that somehow the Tempter had tempted you and our labor might have been for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, Timothy has returned to us from you and has told us the good news about your faith and love. He also told us that you always have fond memories of us and long to see us, just as much as we also long to see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, brothers, in all our distress and affliction, we have been encouraged about you through your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we really live, if you are standing firm in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, how can we thank God enough for you in return for all the joy we have before God on account of you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day we are praying earnestly to see you in person and to supply what is lacking in your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May God our Father himself and our Lord Jesus direct our way to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And may the Lord increase your love and make it overflow for each other and for all people, just as ours does for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he may establish your hearts as blameless in holiness before our God and Father, when our Lord Jesus comes with all his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, beyond this, brothers, just as you received instruction from us about how you are to walk so as to please God (as indeed you are doing), we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus that you do so even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be sure, you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, this is God’s will: that you be sanctified, namely, that you keep yourselves away from sexual immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wants each of you to learn to obtain a wife for yourself in a way that is holy and honorable,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not in lustful passion like the heathen, who do not know God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is to overstep and take advantage of his brother in this matter, because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, just as we said previously and solemnly testified to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God did not call us for uncleanness, but in sanctification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consequently, whoever rejects this is not rejecting a man, but the God who gives you his Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning brotherly love, there is no need to write to you, for you yourselves have been taught by God, with the result that you love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, you are doing so toward all the brothers throughout Macedonia. But we encourage you, brothers, to do this even more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to make it your ambition to live a quiet life, to mind your own business, and to work with your own hands, just as we instructed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this so that you are conducting yourselves decently toward outsiders and are not lacking anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, about those who have fallen asleep, so that you do not grieve in the same way as the others, who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, then in the same way we also believe that God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep through Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, we tell you this by the word of the Lord: We who are alive and left until the coming of the Lord will certainly not go on ahead of those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord himself will come down from heaven with a loud command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet call of God, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up in the clouds together with them, to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will always be with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, encourage one another with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the times and dates, brothers, there is no need to write to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you yourselves know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people are saying, “Peace and security,” destruction will suddenly come on them, like labor pains on a pregnant woman, and they will certainly not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, brothers, are not in the dark so that this day takes you by surprise like a thief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are all sons of the light and sons of the day. We do not belong to the night or the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then let us not sleep like everyone else, but rather let us remain alert and sober.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be sure, those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, get drunk at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, putting on faith and love as a breastplate, and the hope of salvation as a helmet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see, God did not appoint us for wrath, but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, encourage one another and build each other up, just as you are also doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, we ask you to take note of those who work hard among you, who exercise leadership over you in the Lord, and who admonish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold them in the highest regard in love, on account of their work. Live at peace with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also encourage you, brothers, to admonish those who are idle. Encourage those who are discouraged, help those who are weak, and be patient with everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See to it that no one repays evil with evil, but instead, always strive to do good to each other and to everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray without ceasing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In everything give thanks. For this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not extinguish the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not treat prophecies with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But test everything. Hold on to the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep away from every kind of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit, soul, and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who calls you is faithful, and he will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put you under oath to the Lord to read this letter to all the holy brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
